ETYMOLOGY: From Old French almande, from Latin amygdala, from Greek amygdalē.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The edible oval nut-like seed of the almond tree, often used in cooking or eaten as a snack.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 扁桃树的椭圆形可食用果仁，常用于烹饪或作为零食。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: She sprinkled sliced almonds over her salad.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 她在沙拉上撒了一些杏仁片。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The deciduous tree that produces almonds, typically found in warm climates.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 产生杏仁的落叶乔木，通常生长在温暖的气候中。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The almond trees are in full bloom, making the orchard look beautiful.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 杏树开满了花，使果园看起来很美。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word or phrase naming an attribute, added to or grammatically related to a noun to modify or describe it.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Resembling the shape of an almond (typically referring to eyes) or having a pale yellowish-brown color.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 杏仁状的（尤指眼睛的形状）或淡黄褐色的。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: She had striking almond-shaped eyes that were a beautiful shade of brown.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 她有一双引人注目的杏仁状的眼睛，颜色是美丽的棕色。
